data.name: Calm Place
data.description:
Calm Place is a virtual space for tranquility, relaxation and guided meditation. A new part of your daily routine!

Take a moment, sit back and get a few minutes for yourself. Decide the time of your session, make a selection from different guided meditations like body relaxation, deep breathing or start a 7-day mindfulness course. 

Featuring a customizable stylized nature environment where one can experience shifts in weather and time of day creating the illusion of being in a living, breathing place. 

Calm Place was developed as a joint project between Mimerse, renown VR-therapy developers based in Stockholm, and Sweden’s seconds largest hospital. Currently Calm Place is being tested in a clinical trial, where the experience is provided to psychiatric inpatients who feel the need to calm down, reduce stress or anxiety.

Calm Place will be continuously expanded and improved based on users comment and feedback. More meditations and environments are already planned!

changelog.change_log:
-Adjusted the user’s default rotation in the atoll environment to line up better with the shoreline.
-Fixed an issue with occlusion culling that could make certain objects disappear when viewed through certain angles in the atoll environment.
-Fixed some lighting issues in the arctic environment.
-Temporarily removed the yoga mat from the new environments due to clipping issues.
-Fixed an issue that could cause the leaderboard entries to take too long to appear.
-Adjusted the vertical position of the splash screen when first starting the app.

-Added two new environments: Arctic and Tropical Atoll.
-Added chinese language support.
-Breathing sphere text now has localization support.
-Added a yoga mat below the user when choosing to sit on the floor.
-Fixed issue where the main menu object would be colored incorrectly after returning to the lobby from an environment.
-Changed scripting backend to IL2CPP.
-Changed the icons on the location selection panel.
-Changed the splash screen image and removed its animation.
-Made the bonfire sounds quieter.
-Fixed the timing of the geometrical breathing tool.
-Solved graphical glitches that appeared on some of the relaxation objects when using later versions of Android.

- Added support for Android 9.0
-Added “Relaxing objects” to the environment. Click the campfire in the environment to pick and choose between various tools for breathing assistance and relaxation.
-Introduced a new progression system in the form of badges that are earned through various achievements that are displayed in the progress panel.
-The progress panel button now glows if there are new earned badges.
-Removed the leaderboard trophy object and made the leaderboard accessible through the progress panel instead.
-The user is automatically brought back into the lobby after finishing their first ever session.
-Added a popup that asks for the user’s consent to provide mood input data.
-Made Calm Place’s Terms of Service and Privacy Policy viewable through the privacy settings panel.
-Reworked the design of several panels
-Adjusted the timing and ordering of certain voiceover audio clips
-Fixed graphical bug for GearVR that would create visual artifacts on the start menu object.
-Fixed issue where session streak would not increment itself properly.
-Sessions may now trim away less important parts of the voiceover to adjust for the selected session length if necessary.
-Adjusted firefly size and trails
-Fixed bug where clicking on the touchpad could cause the pointer to stop working temporarily.
-Fixed issue that caused the privacy settings panel to not load properly if it was closed and re-opened.
-Fixed bug that could cause artifacts on the back button sprite.
-Fixed issue where the sound effect for clicking on the start menu object in quick succession could desynchronize the audio feedback.
-Changed the timing of the start menu object’s animation to be more in line with the sound effects.
-Changed the pointer scale to be based on distance from head, rather than from the pointer’s origin.
-Fixed issue that caused certain sound effects to become increasingly desynchronized over time in the environment.
-Adjusted seat positioning and scale.
-Adjusted head height for sitting and standing.
-Moved the music volume slider to the music panel.
-The session gong now plays before the voiceover asks the user for mood input.
-Added a new splash screen.
-The sound panel now has a button for resetting audio levels to their initial values.
-Made the sky clear during aurora borealis
-Fixed issue where audio would get cut off suddenly instead of fading out when leaving the environment.
-Added intermediary loading scene for moving back to the lobby scene to reduce lag.
-Fixed certain characters not being displayed in the correct font with Swedish localization enabled.
-Fixed issue where long loading quotes would clip into the loading bar.
-Fixed white aliasing around slider handles.
-Fixed bug where the pointer would disable itself after opening the Oculus menu.
-Revised rainbow timing.
-Fixed issue that could cause seagulls to move through areas they should be avoiding.

*Added the ability to pick and choose between three different music tracks in the environment. 
*Adjusted the timing of when fireflies appear in the environment and made some slight changes to their appearance. 
*Changed the ordering of certain audio clips in the voice over 
*Decreased max size of butterflies in the environment. 
*Seagull roaming area widened. 
*Fixed the sky gradient of dusk/day being mixed up during rain. 
*Adjusted the timing of when falling leaves appear in the environment. 
*Implemented a new splash screen. 
*Optimized curved UI performance. 
*Tightened the hitbox of the menu opener. 
*Slight adjustment to the way daily streaks are calculated (should be a little more lenient now). 
*Fixed issue where the voiceover wouldn’t trim itself properly to fit the selected session length. 
*Fixed issue where the cursor would flicker against the object it was hovering over.
*Fixed issue with UI sound being too quiet in the environment. 
*Fixed issue where one of the UI’s buttons appeared slightly larger than the others. 
*Fixed an issue where the feeling slider input could be placed slightly beyond the limits of the slider. 
*Fixed issue where certain panels would sometimes not set up their closing button properly.

Fixed bug where mindfulness day completion could increment itself multiple times on session completion.
Fixed issue where mindfulness day selection would not update while in the environment.
Fixed an issue that could cause the game to lag when first opening the main menu.
Fixed bug where the user’s seating would sometimes fail to appear properly.

-Made the user’s interaction with the feeling slider more snappy.
-Implemented a leaderboard of daily streaks.
-Implemented a highlighting feature for menu objects.
-Added butterflies and fireflies to the forest environment.
-Improved seagull dodging ability.
-Adjusted the hitboxes for colliders in the environment and added more of them.
-Updated the material for the main menu activator object.

Optimized the UI to increase performance.
Fixed bird glitches.
Added cursor on peripherals in the environment. 
Fixed issue where sound made by animals controlled through the environment option continued, even if the setting was disabled.
Fixed a bug where the menu could soft-lock itself if buttons were clicked in rapid succession.
Made the starting value of the feeling slider input after a completed session set itself to the user’s last input.
Some grammar/spelling fixes.
Fixed an issue where certain sounds were causing audio-crackling.
Fixed an issue where the timing of certain sounds could become offset.
Updated to the latest version of Oculus Integration (1.31.0) for Unity.
Fixed so recentering the view now works properly.
Adjusted sound timing and levels in the environment.
Fixed an issue where the animation for the “hamburger” menu animation would stutter.
Added “team credits” section.

Enabled GPU/CPU throttle for GearVR-devices - improving performance.
Change color of black/white glyphs to green/dark blue (reducing “black smearing”).
Added Oculus Platform integration and entitlement check.
Dropped support for GearVR with phones released prior to S8.
